description: b-Included charge of 21 cents a share from early retirement programs.c-Net loss, which included charge of 13 cents a share from a 1 percent federal tax increase, in the quarter and 9 months. The 9 months was also after a charge of $ 31,704,000, or $ 1.09 a share, from an adjustment in accounting.(Loss)

title: U.N. Council Unanimous In Condemning Iraq Move
description: After more than 12 hours of posturing, bickering and compromising, the Security Council unanimously approved a resolution on Saturday with a clear signal to Iraq that despite differences over how to deal with President Saddam Hussein, Council members were united in condemning his renewed threat to the Persian Gulf region.

title: Ex-Soviet States Need All-Purpose Union; Justified Fear of Russia
description: To the Editor:

title: A Dispute About Disks; U.S. Tries to Keep Secrets That Aren't Any More
description: The cold war is over but the Government has drawn a new line in the sand to control military exports: Technological information can be sent abroad if it is found in a book, but not if it is on a computer disk.

title: Atrocious in Anaheim: Giants' Fuel Gauge Is Now Pointing to Empty
description: When things go bad during a streak like this, or "bad wrong" as Giants Coach Dan Reeves likes to say, they go bad in a hurry. Three straight victories. Now three straight losses. If anyone has any answers -- because the Giants don't -- the team will be fielding calls at 1-900-GOING-DOWNHILL.

title: Bad Back Puts Anthony in Precarious Position
description: As if Greg Anthony did not have enough to think about, he has been bothered by a sore back throughout training camp.

title: Economic Calendar
description: Listed below are the scheduled release dates for major economic indicators this week. Monday Inventory-Sales Ratio . . . Aug. Tuesday None Wednesday Balance of Trade . . . Aug. Thursday Housing Starts . . . Sept. Building Permits . . . Sept. Personal Income . . . 2d Qtr. Weekly Jobless Claims Friday None

title: Some Doubt U.S. Ability To Fight Wars On 2 Fronts
description: America's latest military showdown with Iraq, at a time when United States forces are in Haiti, is raising questions about the Pentagon's ability to meet its strategy to win two major wars at nearly the same time.

title: Camden's Aquarium Risks Ignominy; Drab Exhibits a Problem as Complex Fails to Lift Waterfront
description: Boston's aquarium has coral reefs. New York's has breeding whales. Baltimore's has dolphin shows. Camden's has brown fish from New Jersey. Sound like a sales problem?

title: Evidence Re-examined: A special report; Questions Raised In One Conviction In Blast at Towers
description: All through his trial in the World Trade Center bombing case, it was clear that Ahmad M. Ajaj was in a different category from his three co-defendants. Unlike the others, he could not have been part of the actual bombing, since he was in prison at the time. Furthermore, there was no evidence that he had even previously known any of the other men on trial.

title: Credit Unions Throw a Lifeline to the Poor
description: To the Editor:

title: Teacher Salaries
description: Public-school teacher salaries in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut have leveled off after rising faster than the rate of inflation earlier in the decade. Salaries rose as efforts to improve education focused attention on the problems of the nation's public schools. Teachers in the region are still among the best paid in the nation but tightening state budgets and contentious collective bargaining have held down pay raises. The region still devotes a greater share of its school budgets to teacher salaries compared with other parts of the country. Nationally, the share of school budgets that went for salaries was 52 percent in 1964; this year it was down to 39 percent.

title: EG&G Inc.(EGG,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 2
description: b-Included income from discontinued operations of $ 8,646,000, or 15 cents a share, in the quarter and $ 22,632,000, or 41 cents a share, in the 9 months. The periods also included one-time restructuring charge of $ 30.4 million and a write-down of goodwill of $ 40.3 million.c-Net income, which included income from discontinued operations of $ 4,947,000, or 9 cents a share, in the quarter and $ 22,480,000, or 40 cents a share, in the 9 months. The 9 months was also after a charge of $ 7.3 million, or 13 cents a share, from the cumulative effect of accounting change for income taxes, and a charge of $ 13.2 million, or 23 cents a share, from the cumulative effect of accounting change for postretirement benefits.(Loss)

title: Executive Quits Bates Worldwide
description: Andrew Cracknell, who held several top positions at Bates Worldwide and its agencies in the United States and Britain, has resigned, effective immediately, because of what Bates described as a "yet unresolved contractual dispute."

title: I.B.M. Plans to Cut PC Lines to 4 From 9
description: In an effort to reduce confusion and thin its product line, I.B.M. will announce today that it has cut its personal computer lines from nine to four and introduced several new models. It will also say it is bringing back the brand name that became a household word: IBM PC.

title: Micro Warehouse Inc.(MWHS,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Year-ago periods' share earnings and shares outstanding reflected a 2-for-1 stock split effective April 4, 1994.

title: Commerce Bancshares (CBSH,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Republicans' Campaign Trail Turns Right, Toward Reagan
description: Recall the glory days of Ronald Reagan. Attack Bill Clinton. Forget George Bush. Avoid troublesome social issues like abortion. Attack Washington. Move to the right.

title: Kohl Dismisses Vote Setback but Faces Harder Time
description: Chancellor Helmut Kohl, his governing coalition whittled down to a 10-seat majority in Parliament in elections on Sunday, dismissed the setback today as no obstacle to his governing Germany for another four years.

title: Region News Briefs; Bus Company Is Sued Over Seating for Prayers
description: A woman who refused to change her seat on a bus to accommodate Hasidic men who wanted to conduct prayers filed a sex-discrimination suit today in State Supreme Court.

title: Archer-Daniels-Midland Co.  (ADM,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Archer-Daniels-Midland Co. said its results have been adjusted for a 5 percent stock dividend in September.The company also said the results for the year-ago quarter was hurt by the Midwest flood. The company also said the Revenue Reconciliation Act of 1993 increased federal income tax rates to 35 percent, resulting in increased income tax reserves and a non-recurring income tax charge of $ 13,654,000, or 4 cents a share.

title: Corrections
description: An article on Thursday about President Clinton's fall political strategy referred incorrectly in some editions to his standard campaign speech. It indeed mentions the failed attempt to enact sweeping health care legislation: it says Republican lawmakers thwarted the effort.

title: Star Banc Corp.(STB,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
The Montreal Symphony's Lush Instrumental Palette
description: The Montreal Symphony's two programs at Carnegie Hall over the weekend never let listeners forget the power of instrumental color: how sound in its sheer sensuousness can remake interval, rhythm and counterpoint into music that is virtually new.

title: Oakley, the Indestructible Man, Is Hurting
description: Charles Oakley said today that he has been playing on a painful, dislocated right toe that has forced him to consider surgery. But surgery does not appear to be a remedy, according to Dr. Norman Scott, the Knicks' team physician.

title: No Headline
description: "No one lost, no one won, we all won." -- YITHAK RABIN. [ A12:1. ]

title: Supreme Court Roundup; Justices Accept Case Testing the Reach of a Racketeering Law
description: The Government's effort to convict a former Federal prosecutor for using drug trafficking proceeds to mine gold in Alaska presented the Supreme Court today with an important legal question: when does an activity have a sufficient connection with interstate commerce to justify prosecution under the Federal racketeering law?

title: Nobel Winners Rose Above Mideast Past
description: To the Editor:

title: TCF Financial Corp.(TCB,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income before merger-related charges was $ 2.70 a share. During the first half of 1993, TCF acquired Republic Capital Group Inc. of Milwaukee and recorded after-tax merger-related restructuring charges totaling $ 7.9 million.

title: Apple Computer's Earnings Soar, but Its Stock Slumps $1.375
description: Apple Computer Inc. reported late today that its earnings soared in its fiscal fourth quarter, exceeding Wall Street's estimates.

title: COMPANY BRIEFS
description: BANKNORTH GROUP INC., Burlington, Vt., a bank holding company, has completed the purchase of North American Bank Corp. and its subsidiary, Farmington National Bank, Farmington, N.H., for about $19.1 million. H. J. HEINZ CO., Pittsburgh, agreed to acquire All American Gourmet Co., Orange, Calif., the maker of Budget Gourmet frozen meals, from Philip Morris Cos. Terms were not disclosed.

title: THEATER
description: Telling Precious Secrets Just as Children Do Theater at St. Clement's

title: Citizens Banking Corp.(CBCF,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Bonds Rally To Recoup Early Losses
description: Treasury bonds pared early losses that were prompted by a fall in the dollar and ended little changed yesterday.

title: Police Move Street Vendors In Harlem
description: Hundreds of police officers descended on 125th Street in Harlem yesterday to carry out the Giuliani administration's order to clear the busy thoroughfare of street vendors, and 22 people were arrested as scuffles broke out between the illegal merchants and officers.

title: A New Royal Squabble: Charles vs. Father
description: Prince Philip, the Duke of Edinburgh, delivered a public rebuke today to his son, the Prince of Wales, for cooperating with a biography that presents the Prince as someone who underwent a lonely childhood, has an unsatisfactory relationship with his parents and was browbeaten into a loveless marriage.

title: National City Corp.(NCC,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
First Chicago Corp.(FNB,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included charge of $ 7 million from the elimination of 600 jobs in its Community Banking Group in both the quarter and 9 months.

title: Provident Bancorp Inc.(PRBK,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Aqueduct's Fall Season Set
description: One century after it opened for the first time, Aqueduct will open its autumn season in Queens today with racing six days a week and with 30 stakes booked over the next two months, but with no guarantee of its long-range future as the home of winter racing in New York.

title: Market Place; S.& P., responding to its rival, introduces a new stock index.
description: WHEN it comes to stock gauges, most investors know one better than any other: the Dow Jones industrial average. But within the world of big institutions, indexes from two companies vie for supremacy, with Standard & Poor's ahead but being challenged by the Frank Russell Company.

title: The Whitman Shuffle
description: One of Christine Todd Whitman's first acts as Governor of New Jersey nine months ago was to commute the death sentence of Taro, the Akita convicted of biting a 10-year-old girl, on the condition that the dog leave the state forever. The solution pleased outraged dog lovers, while the Governor's aides rejoiced that publicity over the pending execution had been defused. But though "out of sight, out of mind" is surely expedient, what does it say to the next 10-year-old unlucky enough to cross the dog's path?

title: Comerica (CMA,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Iraq Fails to Act on Security Council Proposal to Recognize Kuwait's Borders
description: The Iraqi Parliament held a closed session today that had been expected to yield formal recognition of Kuwait's sovereignty, but the meeting broke up without any acknowledgement that the lawmakers had even discussed the issue.

title: Juggling Policy on Gay Troops
description: The Clinton Administration is marshaling its best legal arguments and financial resources to defend new regulations barring openly homosexual troops in the military, Administration and outside lawyers say.

title: Sellars's Merchant Of Venice Beach
description: At 37, Peter Sellars, the enfant terrible of the American theater, is no longer an enfant, but terrible is still an operative adjective.

title: Conquering the 'No Space' Barrier: a Printer, Copier and Fax
description: THOSE of us who work in home offices are not like normal people, analysts and market researchers agree, at least when it comes to technology.

title: Giuliani Moves Slowly on Privatizing City Hospitals
description: Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani, who campaigned on a promise to privatize public hospitals, has found the process far more complicated, both substantively and politically, than anyone had anticipated, both critics and supporters of the plan say.

title: TRANSACTIONS
description: Baseball American League BALTIMORE ORIOLES -- Named Mike Flanagan pitching coach.

title: Corrections
description: The "On Golf" column on Sunday about the Masters tournament referred incorrectly to a journalist once banned from broadcasting the event. The journalist, Heywood Hale Broun, is not "late"; his father, the reporter Heywood Broun, died in 1939.

title: Victim's Sister Denounces Simpson-Related Halloween Costumes
description: As jury selection in the murder case against O. J. Simpson entered its fourth day, a sister of Nicole Brown Simpson complained today that people were trying to profit from her family's loss by selling Halloween masks portraying both the victim and the murder suspect.

title: Researchers Find Gene That May Link Dyslexia With Immune Disorders
description: BY comparing the reading test scores and genetic codes of hundreds of children, researchers have found the approximate location of a gene that seems to be associated with dyslexia, a complex disorder that prevents millions of people from ever learning to read well.

title: Plan to Clean Holy River Fails to Stem Tide of Filth
description: THE stench of chemicals, leather, rotting flesh and stale air overwhelms visitors to Jajmau, a neighborhood on the edge of Kanpur, home to 175 tanneries on the southern bank of the Ganges River. A brief shower converts the little enclave of bumpy roads and semipaved lanes, lined with hides and bark used for dyeing, into a squalid mess.

title: Corrections
description: Because of an editing error, an article in Business Day on Friday about the response of the Matsushita Electric Industrial Company to a proposed purchase of the company's entertainment subsidiary, MCA Inc., misidentified the head of MCA's record business. He is Al Teller, chairman and chief executive; David Geffen is the chief executive of Geffen Records, also owned by MCA.

title: Mercantile Bankshares Corp.(MRBK,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Russians Make Their Voice Heard
description: Inevitably, there were handshakes and smiles all around today in New York as the Russian Foreign Minister, Andrei V. Kozyrev, met his American counterpart, Warren M. Christopher.

title: Ski Deal Approved
description: S-K-I Ltd. said today that its offer to purchase the Waterville Valley Ski Area for $10.2 million had been approved by the court overseeing the Waterville Company's Chapter 11 bankruptcy proceedings. S-K-I said it had also signed an agreement to acquire the Waterville Valley conference center from the Waterville Company for $1.2 million. Waterville reported more than 300,000 skier visits each season and had ski-related revenue of $11 million annually. S-K-I owns and operates five ski resorts in New England and California.

title: Observer; Time to Fear and Hate
description: Scheduled to be away from home on Election Day, I have just sealed and mailed my absentee ballot.

title: Alcorn Considered for Liberty Bowl
description: Alcorn State is being considered for the Liberty Bowl game, the game's selection committee chairman said. The panel, expecting the host team for the Dec. 31 game in Tennessee to be the winner of the Nov. 19 East Carolina-University of Memphis game, is considering Alcorn for the opposing team, said the chairman, REGGIE BARNES. The panel will be closely watching Southeastern Conference and Big 10 teams, Barnes said. But in case those teams are committed, the Memphis-based bowl is asking the National Collegiate Athletic Association for permission to invite Alcorn State, which features the record-setting quarterback STEVE McNAIR. N.C.A.A. rules say bowl teams must win at least six games against Division I-A competition. Alcorn State (5-2) is tied for second in the Division 1-AA Southwestern Athletic Conference. The Braves have no Division I-A opponents. (AP)

title: Regions Financial (RGBK,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
CHRONICLE
description: Several years ago, WILLIAM M. KUNSTLER represented David Hampton, the young impostor whose scams perpetrated on several prominent New Yorkers became the basis of the play "Six Degrees of Separation."

title: By Design; Belts, Heels and Flying Feathers
description: The waistline and the foot received a lot of attention in the European spring shows.

title: In Tranquil Town Beset by Drugs, Mothers on Patrol Put Dealers on Notice
description: The mothers' crime patrol was out on the streets in the chill the other night, looking for telltale signs of drug dealing: youths with fat backpacks and oversized hoods or passing cars with headlights blinking or dark.

title: Accounts
description: * Brothers Gourmet Coffees Inc., Boca Raton, Fla., to Harris Drury Cohen, Fort Lauderdale, Fla., as the first agency to handle advertising for the coffee company. Billings were not disclosed. * Delta Business Systems, Orlando, Fla., to Cramer-Krasselt, Orlando, to handle the office equipment company's account, previously at Clarke Advertising and Public Relations, St. Petersburg, Fla. Billings were estimated to exceed $1 million.

title: For G.E., Sale Was Fast and Cheap
description: The General Electric Company got rid of its unpleasant association with Kidder, Peabody sooner than expected and, based on some analysts' estimates, possibly at a smaller loss than had been anticipated.

title: Islanders Sign 19-Year-Old Defenseman
description: The Islanders said yesterday that they have come to terms with the 19-year-old defenseman BRYAN McCABE. McCabe, the Islanders' second pick in the 1993 entry draft, would have gone back into the draft had the team not signed him by June 1, 1995. DON MALONEY, the Islanders' general manager, said the two parties agreed on a three-year deal with an option before the league-mandated Saturday afternoon deadline for signing players. McCabe, who had 22 goals, 84 points and 218 penalty minutes in the junior leagues last season, is currently playing with Spokane of the Western Hockey League. McCabe had been assigned to Spokane before the lockout and would not have been eligible for recall if the season had started on schedule.

title: For 13, Change Brings A Chill
description: The announcement last week that the "MacNeil/Lehrer Newshour" intended to abandon WNET, the station where the program began 20 years ago, has set off the latest round of doomsaying at Channel 13, New York's long-suffering public television station.

title: THE 1994 CAMPAIGN: Campaign Briefs; California Candidate Sets Donation Record
description: In what is believed to be a record campaign gift by a candidate to himself, Representative Michael Huffington, a Republican, has contributed almost $10 million of his personal fortune to his campaign for the United States Senate and has lent his campaign an additional $7 million.

title: METRO DIGEST
description: POLICE REORGANIZATION RECOMMENDED

title: ISRAEL AND JORDAN SIGN DRAFT OF WIDE-RANGING PEACE TREATY
description: Israel and Jordan initialed a draft peace treaty today clearing the way for regular diplomatic relations, enhanced commerce and easier travel after 46 years of veering between warfare and uneasy coexistence.

title: Peoples Heritage Financial Group Inc.(PHBK,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: All figures restated to reflect the July 31 acquisition of Mid Maine Savings Bank in accordance with the pooling of interests method of accounting.

title: Pizza, Chicken Wings And Iron Mike's Binky
description: In the frenzy of excitement about pro football studio shows that overtakes at least a baker's dozen of people each season, NBC's "The N.F.L. Live" has been overwhelmed by the attention paid to "Fox N.F.L. Sunday."

title: Another Head Rolls: Cubs Fire Trebelhorn
description: The Chicago Cubs fired Manager TOM TREBELHORN yesterday. He is the fifth manager to be dismissed since the season was stopped by the players' strike. Trebelhorn, hired at the start of the season, was the Cubs' 10th manager in 10 years. Chicago finished last in the National League Central with a 49-64 record, the second-worst in the league. Trebelhorn was hired in the off-season by the Cubs' former general manager, LARRY HIMES, who was demoted to a scouting job two weeks ago. ED LYNCH, hired last week to replace Himes, announced Trebelhorn's firing.

title: NEWS SUMMARY
description: International A3-17 A PACT FOR ISRAEL AND JORDAN Jordan and Israel initialed a draft peace treaty that will address water and land issues between them and maintain the momentum of Middle East peace efforts. A1

title: Style Over Substance
description: To the Editor:

title: Mr. Kohl Again, Underwhelmingly
description: With a notable lack of enthusiasm, German voters gave narrow support Sunday to their least risky choice, Chancellor Helmut Kohl and his center-right Government. But Mr. Kohl will have to struggle to make any headway during his fourth four-year term since 1982. His parliamentary majority was shaved to 10 votes, and his coalition partners, the Free Democrats, just managed to squeak by the 5 percent threshold needed to assure their seats in the Bundestag.

title: It's Kerrigan and 'Ice Wars,' but Not What You Think
description: Nancy Kerrigan has always had this inner tug-of-war, loving to perform but feeling ill at ease in public. She seemed to disappear after the Winter Olympics, as if she had landed a triple jump and burrowed into the ice, her reputation no longer as sterling as her silver medal.

title: TIME WARNER INC. (TWX,N)
description: Time Warner Inc. said yesterday that its loss in the third quarter had narrowed substantially to $35 million, or 9 cents a share, from a loss from operations of $111 million, or 30 cents a share, in the corresponding quarter last year, when a $22 million charge for debt retirement resulted in a net loss of $136 million, or 36 cents a share.

title: New Golf Travel Service
description: The New York Times Sports/Leisure Magazines, which publishes magazines that include Golf Digest and Golf World, said yesterday that the group would introduce a travel division that offers one-stop shopping for customized golf travel.

title: On Minority Performers
description: A discussion on the use of minority performers in traditionally nonminority operatic roles is to take place at 8 tonight at St. Peter's Church, Lexington Avenue at 54th Street. Patrick J. Smith, the editor of Opera News, is to be the host of the discussion with the soprano Marina Arroyo; the playwright Albert Innaurato; Linda Jackson, the general director of the Chautauqua Opera Company; Daniel Swee, the casting director for Lincoln Center Theater, and Thomas Young, a tenor. The event is among the Metropolitan Opera Guild's 1994-95 lecture series. Tickets are $12. Information: (212) 769-7028.

title: Beaten Officer Goes Home
description: A transit police officer who was brutally beaten by a group of young men in Bay Ridge, Brooklyn, two weeks ago was released from Bellevue Hospital Center yesterday The officer, Detective Sgt. Louis Cosentino, had been awakened early Oct. 2 by a disturbance in front of his apartment. When he confronted about 10 youths, they took his gun and beat him unconscious, breaking most of his facial bones. Nine youths have been arrested in the attack.

title: Brown's Top Status Isn't Quite So Secure
description: Don't make too much of it, at least for now. But the Giants have lost their last three games after winning their first three, and for the first time, Coach Dan Reeves said today that he might change quarterbacks.

title: United Carolina Bancshares Corp.(UCAR,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a charge of $ 316,000, or 2 cents a share, from an adjustment in accounting.c-After a gain of $ 855,000, or 6 cents a share, from an adjustment in accounting.United Carolina Bancshares completed the acquisition of the Bank of Iredell effective at the close of business Aug. 31, 1994. Prior period financial statements have been restated for the acquisition, which was accounted for as a pooling-of-interests.

title: U S WEST INC. (USW,N)
description: U S West reported a rise in its third-quarter earnings yesterday and announced that it would slow the pace of a plan to cut 9,000 jobs.

title: KODAK'S STOCK FALLS ON REPORTS OF COST-CUTTING
description: The shares of the Eastman Kodak Company fell yesterday in heavy trading for a second day amid reports that the company was falling behind its annual operating plan and would have to slash costs to meet year-end financial goals. The cost cuts were outlined in an internal memo distributed to 20 senior executives. The memo, dated Sept. 20, mandated across-the-board cuts, including accelerated staff reductions, cutbacks in purchasing supplies and a $5 million reduction in spending on research and development. The memo said some new products could be delayed as a result. Kodak's stock closed down $1.375, to $48.125, on trading of 3.5 million shares on the New York Stock Exchange. The shares fell $2 on Friday.

title: KeyCorp (KEY,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Year-ago results are restated for the March 1, 1994, merger with Society Corp., accounted for as a pooling of interests.

title: G. M. Trucks Found to Be Fire Hazard Side-Saddle Tanks
description: Transportation Secretary Federico F. Pena said yesterday that a two-year Federal investigation of 4.5 million older General Motors Corporation pickup trucks had found that the trucks posed a fire hazard when hit from the side because of the placement of their fuel tanks.

title: Harlem Dancers Open New Home
description: Dance Theater of Harlem has formally opened its new Everett Center, a $7.5 million renovation and expansion of its headquarters on West 152d Street.

title: Key Rates
description: In percent

title: From Giuliani, More Scolding
description: Even as Bernadette Castro complained about Senator Alfonse M. D'Amato's party loyalty, another Republican -- Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani -- complained yesterday that the Senator had misbehaved at a ground-breaking ceremony for a Holocaust museum in lower Manhattan on Sunday.

title: Logging Thrives on Economic Scare Tactics
description: To the Editor:

title: People v. Hamlet: A Case of Infinite Jest; Scholars of the Law and Shakespeare Hear the Prince's Appeal
description: When you're trying to get your client's conviction reversed, six homicides can be a tad much to explain away. Particularly when the judges know the case as well as, if not better than, you do. And especially when hundreds of onlookers -- colleagues at the bar whom your client has insulted (he once gleefully asked a gravedigger, "Why might not that be the skull of a lawyer?") -- are leaning forward, salivating.

title: Police Report Recommends More Training and Oversight
description: A Police Department task force has recommended a sweeping reorganization that would raise standards for recruitment and graduation from the police academy and require monthly performance evaluations of officers.

title: Sports of The Times; Judo Champ Doesn't Need Disguises
description: IN order to compete with her friends in judo, Rusty Kanokogi wrapped tape around her chest -- "so they looked like healthy pectorals, not breasts." She flung a few men around in competition, but eventually somebody figured out why she was changing in a broom closet, and she gave the medals back.

title: A Contract Out on Workers' Rights
description: BACK in the room he shares with two friends, Pedro Azurdia was acting like the luckiest man in the world for the two or three days a week of hard labor coming his way.

title: Food Safety Requires Stricter Laws
description: To the Editor:

title: Cheating on Base Closings
description: Six years ago, in a stroke of political enlightenment, Congress created a new process for shutting unneeded military bases. It assigned an independent commission the unpleasant business of picking bases to close. Congress can overrule the commission's entire list, but has not done so. The concept seemed flawless; the execution less so.

title: Adflex Solutions
description: Shares of Adflex Solutions Inc., a maker of computer parts, rose sharply in Nasdaq trading yesterday after the company announced that third-quarter earnings more than doubled. The company, based in Chandler, Ariz., went public on Sept. 27 at $13.50 a share.

title: Unisys Corp.(UIS,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included extraordinary charge of $ 7.7 million, or 4 cents a share, from costs associated with the repurchase of debt.c-Included extraordinary charge of $ 26.4 million, or 16 cents a share, and after a gain of $ 230.2 million, or $ 1.39 a share, from an adjustment in accounting.

title: On My Mind; The Peace Prize Winners
description: The winners of the 1994 Nobel Peace Prize have good reasons to allow themselves the pleasure and pride of accomplishment.

title: Yanks' Key Set for Surgery
description: Jimmy Key will have arthroscopic surgery on his left shoulder tomorrow to determine whether the chronic weakness that he has endured since the second half of the season can be alleviated.

title: Thompson Officer Leaves for McCann
description: Nina DiSesa, who has been the executive vice president and executive creative director at J. Walter Thompson Chicago for the last three years, is leaving to return to McCann-Erickson New York in a similar position, effective Nov. 7.

title: BUSINESS DIGEST
description: International Mexico will allow 46 foreign finanicial companies to begin operations. The opening of the financial-services market represents a milestone in the redesign of the Mexican economy. [ Page D1. ]

title: Corrections
description: A map on Sunday showing gravesites of famous people at Green-Wood Cemetery in Brooklyn misstated Samuel F. B. Morse's accomplishment. He invented the electric telegraph, not the wireless telegraph.

title: Miami Dips Into Its Pool Of Talent
description: James Stewart, the 235-pound Miami running back and a prime pro prospect, has had his twisted ankle placed in a cast, and it is uncertain whether he will play on Saturday when the Hurricanes are at West Virginia.

title: INSIDE
description: How Paine Webber Plans To Make Kidder Deal Work

title: Logging Thrives on Economic Scare Tactics; Mining's False Prophets
description: To the Editor:

title: Patterns
description: Thierry Mugler on a Roll

title: BancorpSouth Inc.(BOMS,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a gain from an accounting adjustment of $ 3,200,000, or 41 cents a share.

title: Standard Federal Bank (SFB,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Northern Trust Co.(NTRS,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Groark Stays the Course As Campaign Sinks
description: An early surprise in Connecticut's race for governor is the fall in the polls of Lieut. Gov. Eunice S. Groark, Gov. Lowell P. Weicker Jr.'s chosen successor, who is favored by fewer than 10 percent of those surveyed, dangerously near the race's fringe candidates.

title: U.S. Criticizes A Russian Aide At U.N. on Iraq
description: In an unusual public clash reminiscent of cold war debates, Russia's Foreign Minister, Andrei V. Kozyrev, came to the Security Council today to win sympathy for Saddam Hussein but was roundly rebuffed by the United States.

title: Ban on N.H.L. Players Lifted
description: The telephone lines between the National Hockey League office in New York and the Players Association office in Toronto remained silent for the sixth successive day yesterday, but other international telephone lines were working overtime.

title: Markets Opened By Mexico
description: Taking a final step to open Mexico's financial markets to the world, the Government announced tonight that it would allow 46 foreign banks, securities firms and insurance companies to begin operations here.

title: Bulging Disk in Neck Sidelines Trevino
description: LEE TREVINO, leading the PGA Seniors circuit in victories this year with six, will be out of action indefinitely because of a bulging disk in his neck. His agent, CHUCK RUBIN, said Trevino has consulted with three doctors, but has not decided what to do.

title: Not Just A Tharp Knockoff
description: Twyla Tharp is notoriously fussy in choosing companies that can perform her dances. Among the groups she has honored with productions are American Ballet Theater, the New York City Ballet, the Joffrey Ballet, the Paris Opera Ballet and, since 1990, Hubbard Street Dance Chicago.

title: City National Corp.(CYN,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss and after income from discontinued operations of $ 7,128,000, or 19 cents a share.The bank said the latest 9 months included gains of $ 2.7 million on completing the sale of properties in the Accelerated Asset Disposition Program and $ 900,000 on the sale of a leveraged lease. The gains contributed 8 cents a share to latest 9 months net income.The year-ago 9 months included a gain of $ 11.3 million on selling a merchant draft business, Equity Line of Credit loans and a data processing business, which was offset by a $ 26.4 million charge related to adoption of the AADP.(Loss)

title: Pataki Gains Endorsement of a Jewish Assemblyman, Across Party Lines
description: Flanked by representatives of New York City's Orthodox Jewish residents, State Assemblyman Dov Hikind endorsed State Senator George E. Pataki for governor yesterday, saying the state needed new leadership.

title: Who's Delaying the Test Ban? Everyone.
description: More than 30 years after the U.S., the Soviet Union and Britain signed a Limited Test Ban Treaty halting nuclear tests in the atmosphere, they are finally getting around to negotiating a comprehensive test ban, barring tests altogether. But they and other nuclear-armed states seem to be looking for ways to limit the new treaty's comprehensiveness. That, in turn, is delaying a final draft.

title: A Spreading Peace?
description: How soon will Syria be next?

title: State Outlines a Far Different Lilco
description: Trying to sell the Cuomo administration's plan for a $9 billion government takeover of the Long Island Lighting Company, state officials have been telling Long Islanders that what the state wants is not just government ownership, but an overhaul of the company.

title: TRAVELERS INC. (TRV,N)
description: Travelers Inc. said yesterday that its third-quarter earnings rose 28 percent as increased revenue from its consumer-lending and insurance businesses offset declines at Smith Barney, its brokerage firm.

title: St. Paul Bancorp Inc.(SPBC,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Per share data has been restated for a 3-for-2 stock split in January.

title: Chevy Chase Savings Bank reports earnings for Year to Sept 30
description: The bank said its 1994 income was $ 52.7 million before taxes, an extraordinary item and an accounting change. The bank said its 1993 income was $ 64 million before those items.

title: Two Concussions Force Hoge to Retire
description: In the hospital he was dazed and lost. MERRIL HOGE didn't know his wife or his brother or that he had a 14-month-old daughter. Two weeks later, he was still in a fog, unable to shake off his second concussion in six weeks. As a result, the 29-year-old running back announced yesterday that he was retiring from football and the Chicago Bears. "It's the end to a career but not to a life," Hoge said at a news conference in Lake Forest, Ill.

title: Japan Plans to Conquer Sea's Depths
description: NO part of Japan is more than 75 miles from the sea. With its fish catch three times that of the United States, its shipyards some of the world's most innovative and its Emperor a marine biologist, the land of nearly 7,000 isles in the past few years has quietly honed its technological skills to become a global leader in probing the depths of the world's seas and working hard to unlock their secrets.

title: Vladiceasca Journal; Where Communists Trampled, a Village Rises
description: Dumitru Pantece remembers with a shudder the day he was standing on the roof and the bulldozers came. Officials from the mayor's office waited outside his house making sure a heartbroken and angry Mr. Pantece obeyed orders. Then the big machine tore into his house and left it a pile of rubble, along with 50 others in this village.

title: Giants Have Found Their Proper Level: .500
description: The Giants win their first three games of the season, all against division rivals, and their supporters are convinced they are the greatest team since the Canton Bulldogs. They lose their next three games and the now unsupportive supporters are convinced they would lose to a 1950 Ivy League 150-pound team.

title: National Westminster Bancorp reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a $ 10 million restructuring charge in connection with the establishment of the Scranton, Pa., facility and the outsourcing of certain processing.c-Included the recognition of previously unrecorded Federal tax benefits, to be utilized by future earnings, of $ 17 million in the quarter and $ 41 million in the 9 months.

title: Haitians Seize Men Accused Of Terror Acts
description: Haitian crowds, acting at the urging of President Jean-Bertrand Aristide, seized dozens of men accused of being gunmen loyal to the former military government and turned them over to the American military police overnight and today.

title: Micron Technology Plans to Acquire Zeos
description: Micron Technology Inc. said today that it would acquire Zeos International Ltd., a Minneapolis-based telephone-order supplier of personal computers. Zeos will be merged with Micron Computer Inc. and Micron Custom Manufacturing Services Inc., two Micron subsidiaries.

title: Executive Changes
description: BIOMECHANICS CORP. OF AMERICA, Melville, L.I., appointed Michael Strauss president and chief operating officer. CARELINE Inc., Irvine, Calif., a provider of ambulance services, named J. Scott Adams president and chief operating officer. M. Keith Huzyak, who had been president, remains chairman and chief executive.

title: RESULTS PLUS
description: TENNIS Kafelnikov Wins Second-seeded Yevgeny Kafelnikov of Russia beat Australia's Richard Fromberg, 6-4, 6-4, yesterday to highlight the opening round at the $600,000 Lyons Open tennis tournament in Lyons, France. A qualifier, Lars Rehmann of Germany, upset Tomas Carbonell of Spain, 6-3, 6-3, and Andrei Chesnokov of Russia defeated a Frenchman, Rodolphe Gilbert, 7-6 (9-7), 6-3. (AP) Korda Beats Skoff: Fifth-seeded Petr Korda of the Czech Republic defeated the hometown favorite, Horst Skoff, 6-1, 7-6 (7-4), yesterday in the opening round of the $375,000 CA-Tennis Trophy tournament in Vienna. The top-seeded players, including Goran Ivanisevic, the United States Open champion Andre Agassi, Germany's Michael Stich and Thomas Muster of Austria, do not see action until midweek. (AP) YACHT RACING Davis Wins Gold Cup Rod Davis, the Californian who moved to Australia two years ago to skipper a boat from Down Under for the 1995 America's Cup races, won the Omega Gold Cup match-racing series on Sunday in Bermuda. Davis edged out world-class skippers like Chris Dickson, Peter Gilmour and Ed Baird.

title: Toward Irish Peace
description: To the Editor:

title: CHRONICLE
description: REGINE CRESPIN, 67, France's most celebrated postwar opera singer, has often been treated more lovingly by other countries than by her own. But last week, Prime Minister EDOUARD BALLADUR marked her contribution to the nation with the insignia of Commander in the Legion of Honor and, of course, a kiss on each cheek.

title: Beating a Sales Slump With a Classic Formula
description: Contrarian is not the first word one would associate with Talbots.

title: JOHN HANCOCK TO BUY TRANSAMERICA MUTUAL FUND UNIT
description: John Hancock Mutual Funds agreed yesterday to acquire the mutual fund unit of the Transamerica Corporation for about $100 million. John Hancock Mutual Funds, a wholly owned subsidiary of the John Hancock Mutual Life Insurance Company of Boston, said it wanted to increase its assets under management to $30 billion from about $11.5 billion. Transamerica's mutual fund unit, the Transamerica Fund Management Company, oversees about $3 billion spread among 17 funds. Transamerica, based in San Francisco, said it expected to report a small gain from the sale.

title: Alco Standard Corp.(ASN,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a $ 95 million after-tax charge resulting from the sale of its interest in IMM Office Systems.c-Net lossd-Included a loss from discontinued operations of $ 10,733,000, or 23 cents a share, in the quarter and $ 7,515,000, or 16 cents a share, in the year.The company said the year-ago period included pretax restructuring costs of $ 175 million for Unisource.Latest quarter and year are after preferred dividends of $ 2,893,000 and $ 11,572,000, respectively, compared with year-ago quarter of $ 3,464,000, and $ 9,571,000 for the year.(Loss)

title: Peter D. Gould, 50, Broadway Designer
description: Peter David Gould, a production designer for such Broadway shows as "Cats" and "Miss Saigon," died yesterday at the Brigham and Women's Hospital in Boston. He was 50 and lived in Brooklyn Heights.

title: Review/Fashion; Chanel's Message: Dress to Seduce
description: As "The Age of Aquarius" boomed on the sound system, Karl Lagerfeld, designing for Chanel, showed how he believes women should face a new age: hoisted and borne on pedestals of beefy male flesh. His finale today had all the female models sitting on male models' shoulders.

title: City's Advice on Central Park: Take a Friend
description: As he moved into the pale wash of a lantern alongside the Central Park Reservoir at 8:30 last night, Sammy Busby had the long straightaway on the western side of the reservoir jogging track to himself.

title: Carroll's New Tack: Expect Much More
description: It shouldn't have surprised Pete Carroll, but it did -- some players need motivating. Carroll is still learning on the job as the rookie head coach of the Jets, learning week by week with a franchise that has, ultimately, let down almost every coach in its history.

title: Gay Survey Raises a New Question
description: To the question of "How many homosexuals are there in America?" a new nationwide study has provided a striking range of numbers and an unanswered question of its own: What is a homosexual?

title: Montreal's Alou Named Manager of Year
description: FELIPE ALOU, who guided the young Montreal Expos to the best record in the majors before the strike stopped the season, was a near-unanimous choice yesterday as the National League's manager of the year. Alou got 27 of 28 first-place votes, with DALLAS GREEN of the Mets receiving the other one. The Expos, who have shown steady improvement in Alou's two-plus seasons, exceeded even their own expectations this year by going 74-40. Alou received one second-place vote and finished with 138 points in balloting by the Baseball Writers Association of America. Cincinnati's DAVEY JOHNSON finished second with 51 points. (AP)

title: Pension Takeover Sought for Western Union
description: The Federal Pension Benefit Guaranty Corporation moved yesterday to take over Western Union's pension plan, contending that a proposal to take the company's parent, the New Valley Corporation, out of bankruptcy fails to adequately protect present and future pensioners.

title: Ties to Gangsters Hinder Overhaul of Japan Banking
description: Few here had heard of Gifu Shogin, a small credit association about 180 miles west of Tokyo, before the Japanese Government forced it to merge with another local financial institution several months ago. But then a stunning fact was disclosed: of Gifu Shogin's $110 million in outstanding loans, about $70 million worth was made to organized-crime groups or their affiliated companies.

title: U.S. Trust Corp.(USTC,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Per share earnings are fully diluted.

title: POP
description: Southern African Traditions Updated With Spirit Symphony Space

title: New Puzzle On Sex Life Of Octopus
description: Scientists surveying a hydrothermal vent about 10,000 feet deep, on the ocean floor 1,000 miles west of Guatemala, report having come across two male octopuses of different species having sex.

title: Wachovia Corp.(WB,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Review/Fashion; Valentino in His Element: Glamour Without Camp
description: In a season when glamour rules the runways, Valentino is in his element. His collection on Sunday captured the essence of glamour without the slightest tinge of campiness. The word repeated by most people leaving the show was "beautiful."

title: Region News Briefs; Faculty Back in Class At C.W. Post Campus
description: Classes returned to normal today at the C. W. Post campus of Long Island University as faculty members ended a brief walkout, but the dispute over a new contract continued.

title: THE 1994 CAMPAIGN: Campaign Briefs; Learning the Hazards Of Full Disclosure
description: Bruce Benson thought he would score points for being honest. Without prompting, the Republican, who is trying to unseat Gov. Roy Romer, a Democrat, disclosed last month that he had twice been charged with drunken driving in the early 1980's. And then came the details of his divorce, a rather lurid case that involved accusations of adultery and lavish spending on his mistress.

title: Old Kent Financial Corp.(OKEN,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
School's Integration Falling Short of Ideal
description: Anyone who still believes or hopes or dreams that America's schools are models for a more racially and ethnically integrated society will find "School Colors" dispiriting. This revealing two-and-a-half-hour look at the 1993-94 academic year at Berkeley High in California, partly through the lenses of student video journalists, finds divisions and tensions that defy the best-intentioned efforts of teachers and administrators.

title: Argentina's Revival Doesn't Include Electricity and Telephone
description: Many Argentines believe that their country is undergoing a renaissance that will regain the ground lost over the last 60 years, restoring Argentina to a place among the world's 10 most affluent nations.

title: Chess
description: No one plays such brash sacrifices as Gary Kasparov. Others may take risks against much weaker opponents, but the Professional Chess Association's world champion dives repeatedly into the realm of the speculative against his chief rivals. And wins.

title: First Michigan Bank Corp.(FMBC,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
A Sermon on Child Neglect and Crime
description: President Clinton flew west today to give a speech to police chiefs about crime. But by its end, he had instead spun an angry sermon on the nation's duty to a generation of children whose hearts, he said, were being "turned to stone" by violence and neglect.

title: Drugs Fail Tests; Shares Plunge
description: The shares of two start-up drug companies plunged today after the companies said their most important drugs had flunked human tests.

title: NBD Bancorp Inc.(NBD,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included an extraordinary charge of $ 7,730,000, or 5 cents a share, from debt redemption, and after a charge of $ 7,885,000, or 5 cents a share, from an adjustment in accounting.c-After a gain of $ 3,950,000, or 3 cents a share, from an adjustment in accounting.

title: Eurotunnel Slow Sales
description: The operators of the tunnel linking Britain and France said today that they expected to generate only $:34 million ($54 million) in revenue this year, a quarter of what they projected five months ago.

title: THE MEDIA BUSINESS: Advertising; Advertisers gather to face their worst fears of mysterious interactive media.
description: In 1958, Billy Wilder came to the Hotel del Coronado here to film "Some Like It Hot." Thirty-six years later, the Association of National Advertisers has come to the same resort for an event that might be called "Some Like It Interactive."

title: California Micro Down
description: The shares of the California Micro Devices Corporation plunged as much as 46 percent today after the company said it had appointed a committee of independent directors to investigate "accounting irregularities."

title: First-Time Explorers Can Get Lost in the Internet
description: SO much is written about the Internet, the vast worldwide network of computers, that it is easy for relatively naive users to feel left out. "Relatively naive" can mean people who operate a computer at the office or at home and perhaps even belong to a commercial on-line service, but are by no means experts.

title: Corrections
description: A brief sports article on Sunday about the American Horse Show Association Junior Jumper Championships misidentified the horse ridden by James Darrow. It was Madame X.

title: THE 1994 CAMPAIGN: Campaign Briefs; Kennedy Rally Ponders A Republican Future
description: Sometimes it is hard to get voters riled up about a clean-cut Republican challenger like Mitt Romney, the businessman running against Senator Edward M. Kennedy, since there is no record to attack.

title: U.S. Jets Fly Dry Runs on Iraq Targets to Show 'We're Here'
description: Comdr. Charles Hautau of Branchville, N.J., wolfed down a meatball hero aboard this huge floating airfield, the newest of the Navy's nuclear-powered aircraft carriers, and talked about how he had spent his morning.

title: Stalking Stickley, Pursuing Ming
description: At the Seventh Regiment Armory, on Park Avenue in Manhattan, is a bronze horse and chariot from the second century A.D. "I have people panting to buy it," an antique dealer told Carol Vogel of The Times. He is asking $3.5 million.

title: Sanders Certainly Didn't Pull Punches, but Did the Referees?
description: Typically, when two National Football League players exchange blows during a game, they are given personal fouls and ejected. But when 49er cornerback Deion Sanders and Falcon receiver Andre Rison got into a fight in the second quarter of the San Francisco-Atlanta game on Sunday, only Sanders was penalized and both players remained in the game.

title: Samsung's English Plan
description: The Samsung Electronics Company, the South Korean electronics maker, said today that it planned to build a plant worth $:450 million ($715 million) in Wynyard in northeast England. The company also has chosen London for its European headquarters. Samsung said the plant would make a range of electronic equipment, beginning with microwave ovens and computer monitors. Ultimately, it will also produce personal computers, fax machines, color display tubes and semiconductors.

title: Q&A
description: Nesting Boxes

title: Insurgents in Mexico Threaten to Fight if Governor Is Installed
description: Having rejected new peace talks with the Government, peasant rebels in the southern state of Chiapas are threatening to resume fighting if an elected Governor from Mexico's long-governing party tries to take office there as scheduled in December.

title: David L. Ladd Is Dead at 68; Expert on Patents and Copyrights
description: David Lowell Ladd, an authority on intellectual property law who was Commissioner of Patents in the Kennedy Administration, died last Wednesday at his home in Alexandria, Va. He was 68.

title: A Boy of Summer's Long, Chilly Winter; Once a Promising Ballplayer, Glenn Burke Is Dying of AIDS
description: This was one of the bad days. The sheets on the twin bed were twisted, the printed red-and-blue toy cars wrinkled from where he had gripped the cloth too tightly. The cartoons on the television set were no distraction. The bottles of pills on the bedside table were not doing their job.

title: Ford Recalls Compacts, Delaying Production
description: For the second time in two months, the Ford Motor Company is recalling its new Contour and Mystique compact sedans because of a fuel system defect that can cause fires.

title: ITT DELAYS A PLAN FOR A $750 MILLION CASINO
description: The ITT Corporation said yesterday that it was delaying plans to build a $750 million theme casino along the Las Vegas Strip. ITT, based in New York, said it was postponing the project, which was announced in May, because it needed time to complete design plans. It did not say how long the project would be delayed. But ITT said it would spend $85 million in the next 18 months to renovate its Sheraton Desert Inn casino and hotel in Las Vegas. The company acquired the 820-room Desert Inn from the financier Kirk Kerkorian for $160 million last fall. The new resort, to be built next to the Desert Inn, will be called the Desert Kingdom.

title: A Rock Band Confronts Its Fear of Success
description: Almost as soon as anyone had heard of Pavement, the band's songs started to agonize over ambition and the dangers of selling out. "Can you treat it like an oil well/When it's underground and out of sight?" asked one song on the band's 1992 debut album, which cautiously added, "It's what I want." Back then, Pavement was recording for a small label and had been embraced only by college radio stations. Now the band has real reason to worry: its second album, "Crooked Rain, Crooked Rain" (Matador), is distributed through Atlantic Records, and its concert on Saturday night at Roseland was sold out, drawing about 3,400 people.

title: Grgurich Discusses Terms With U.N.L.V.
description: With the job his for the asking, the former Nevada-Las Vegas assistant coach TIM GRGURICH met yesterday with U.N.L.V. officials to discuss his terms for taking over as the university's new basketball coach. Grgurich, who is making a reported $320,000 a year as an assistant with the Seattle SuperSonics, reportedly would receive a similar sum in a proposed three-year deal with U.N.L.V. University officials said Friday that Grgurich was the only candidate for the position when ROLLIE MASSIMINO accepted a $1.8 million buyout of his contract. (AP)

title: COLLEGE SOCCER REPORT
description: Boston University

title: New York Police Will Reflect the City's Population Even Less
description: To the Editor:

title: G.O.P. Senate Contender Asserts D'Amato Is Undercutting Her Bid
description: Bernadette Castro, the embattled Republican nominee for the Senate from New York, said yesterday that Senator Alfonse M. D'Amato had steered contributors away from her campaign and told her that he had agreed not to work against the Democratic incumbent, Daniel Patrick Moynihan, because Mr. Moynihan did not work against him two years ago.

title: Region News Briefs; President Is Selected At L.I. Medical Center
description: Long Island Jewish Medical Center today announced the appointment of Dr. David R. Dantzker as president.

title: Infohighwaymen
description: Intellectual property has become an opulent, sophisticated, even somewhat debauched region of the law. Individuals and corporations have staked legal claims to slogans, facial and vocal likenesses, melodic snippets, genetic sequences, bits of mathematical reasoning, unpublished letters and the look and feel of software programs. It's a little startling, then, to discover that something as traditional as a printed page can still routinely fall prey to acts of verbatim for-profit theft.

title: Kaufman & Broad Chooses Dailey
description: The Kaufman & Broad Home Corporation, a home-building company based in Westwood, Calif., said yesterday that it had selected Dailey & Associates in Los Angeles, to handle its account, which had been at JGMC in Santa Monica, Calif., for the last nine years. Billings were estimated at $20 million. Dailey was awarded the account after a two-month review that was narrowed to two other finalists: DDB Needham Los Angeles and Lintas Campbell-Ewald in Los Angeles. A campaign is expected to begin in January.

title: McGraw-Hill Inc.(MHP,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss, which included nonrecurring charges of $ 229.8 million ($ 160.8 million net of tax benefits, or $ 3.27 a share) for acquisition of partner's 50 percent stake in Macmillan/McGraw-Hill School Publishing Co. Excluding charges, the company reported third-quarter earnings of $ 68.9 million, or $ 1.40 a share, and nine-month earnings of $ 127.4 million, or $ 2.59 a share. It also included third-quarter pretax $ 3.7 million write-down by Canadian unit, McGraw-Hill Ryerson, for discontinuing CanCite.(Loss)

title: First Fidelity Bancorp (FFB,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a gain from an accounting adjustment of $ 2,373,000, or 3 cents a share.

title: FirsTier Financial Inc.(FRST,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Year-ago 9 months' per share earnings are adjusted for 3-for-2 stock split distributed on June 30, 1994.

title: Intel's Profit Climbed 13% In Quarter
description: Under growing pressure from price wars in the microprocessor chip business, the Intel Corporation reported today that its earnings rose 13 percent in the third quarter.

title: Trustmark Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
MCA's Parent Is Said To Be Considering Sale
description: As executives from MCA and its parent company, the Matsushita Electric Industrial Corporation, prepare to meet today, MCA may find its owners more willing to consider selling a controlling interest in the company than Matsushita officials have been indicating in public.

title: Of Winchell and the Power of Gossip
description: WINCHELL Gossip, Power and the Culture of Celebrity By Neal Gabler 681 pages. Alfred A. Knopf. $30.

title: U.S. and North Korea Agree To Build on Nuclear Accord
description: The Clinton Administration announced tonight that United States and North Korean negotiators in Geneva had reached a broad agreement that would freeze North Korea's nuclear weapons program and allow the resumption of international inspections.

title: Democrats Getting No Lift From a Rising Economy
description: The politics in Tennessee epitomizes one of the paradoxes of this unusual election year: The economy is thriving, but President Clinton and the Democrats who support his economic program are getting no credit for it.

title: Colonial BancGroup Inc.(CLBGA,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After an extraordinary charge of $ 463,000, or 6 cents a share, in the quarter and 9 months.

title: POP
description: Singer-Songwriter Festival Offers a Broad Sampling Carnegie Hall

title: On to Syria
description: The draft peace pact with Jordan makes it clear to Israelis that, for good or ill, they are closer to an agreement with Syria and a comprehensive peace for the Middle East.

title: CONE TO BUY GOLDING'S RAYTEX UNIT FOR $58 MILLION
description: The Cone Mills Corporation of Greensboro, N.C., said yesterday that it had agreed in principle to acquire the assets of the Raytex unit of Golding Industries of New York for $58 million. Cone Mills, a maker of denim and home furnishing fabrics, will also assume certain obligations of Golding Raytex. Golding Raytex, with annual sales of $40 million to $45 million, prints wide fabrics used mostly in home furnishings, including comforters and bedspreads.

title: Ecologists Read the Rolls of Vanishing Species on Staten Island
description: WHILE biologists have suspected that the ever-increasing sprawl of human society has taken a toll on native plant species, a lack of detailed historical surveys has left researchers unable to say exactly how many and which ones have suffered.

title: Dollar Hits a 2-Year Low vs. the Mark
description: Buoyed by Sunday's parliamentary election results, the mark rallied today, sending the dollar to a two-year low against the German currency. German bond prices also soared in response to the narrow election victory of Chancellor Helmut Kohl and his coalition Government.

title: Paine Webber's Plan for Kidder
description: To make its purchase of Kidder, Peabody & Company successful, the Paine Webber Group is not counting so much on Kidder's highly regarded brokers, strong research department or some of its investment bankers. It is counting more on the favorable terms of the merger and its own own back office, the humdrum systems operation at the heart of any Wall Street firm.

title: Upjohn Co.(UPJ,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After restructuring and unusual items resulting in a credit of $ 8 million, or 5 cents a share, in the latest quarter and 9 months, compared with charges of $ 183 million, or $ 1.05 a share, in the year-ago quarter, and charges of $ 170 million, or 98 cents a share, in year-ago 9 months.c-Net lossd-Included income from discontinued operations of $ 872,000 in the quarter and $ 1,985,000, or 1 cent a share, in the 9 months, The 9 months was also after a charge of $ 18,906,000, or 11 cents a share, from an adjustment in accounting.(Loss)

title: DANCE
description: Bits and Pieces To Tantalize the Appetite Performance Space 122

title: New Dinosaur Species Surprise Paleontologists
description: FOSSILS of two previously unknown dinosaur species have been found in the Sahara, surprising paleontologists with evidence that could upset ideas about the evolution of dinosaurs after the continents began drifting apart 170 million years ago.

title: First National Bancorp (Ga.) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Cuomo, for One, Seeks to Hitch His Star To Clinton's
description: In a year in which Democratic politicians are fleeing from the outstretched arms of President Clinton, Gov. Mario M. Cuomo, ever the loyalist Democrat, made it clear today that he longs for the Administration's embrace and does not mind returning it. Indeed, he made a repeated point of describing the President as great but misunderstood, a heroic figure whose struggle for popularity sounded very much like his own.

title: BOC Boat in Jeopardy
description: Josh Hall, a 32-year-old British sailor competing in the BOC yacht race round the world, called by radio for help yesterday afternoon after hitting an unknown object at sea. Hall, who was in ninth place among the 19 solo sailors, said that his boat was taking on water quickly and that he was in danger of sinking.

title: Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp.(FRE,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After an extraordinary charge for early retirement of debt of $ 44,000,000, or 24 cents a share.c-After an extraordinary charge for early retirement of debt of $ 20,000,000, or 11 cents a share, and a gain from an accounting adjustment of $ 20,000,000, or 11 cents a share.

title: Correction Officer Charged in Killing of a Queens Man
description: A state correction officer was charged with second-degree manslaughter early today after he fatally shot a 27-year-old Queens man yesterday as the two men struggled on the sidewalk in front of a public housing project, police officials said.

title: First Midwest Bancorp Inc.(FMBI,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Harry George Henn, 75, Author And a Law Professor at Cornell
description: Harry George Henn, an author of several influential law textbooks and a professor emeritus at Cornell University, died last Tuesday at a nursing home in Jacksonville, Fla. He was 75 and lived in Naples, Fla.

title: Dow Rises 13.46 in a Blue-Chip-Only Rally
description: Blue-chip stocks continued their gains yesterday, the sixth advance out of seven sessions, but most of the leading stock indexes dropped slightly. The Dow Jones industrial average rose 13.46 points, to 3,923.93, putting it about 1 percent away from its peak for the year.

title: 'Hair of Dog' Tried as Cure For Autoimmune Disease
description: USING a technique reminiscent of the proverbial "hair of the dog," researchers have modernized an ancient Chinese remedy that shows great promise for treating and perhaps preventing various autoimmune diseases, including rheumatoid arthritis, multiple sclerosis, insulin-dependent diabetes and uveitis, an inflammation of the eye that can cause blindness.

title: JAZZ
description: A Musical Reconsideration Of the Art of Charles Mingus Alice Tully Hall

title: Bruno's Inc.(BRNO,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 24
description: b-After an extraordinary charge of $ 3,288,000, or 4 cents a share, which reflects early extinguishment of debt and the prepayment penalty on the redemption of the company's 6.5 percent convertible subordinated debentures.

title: After 40 Days and 40 Nights, Players and Owners Will Meet in Capital
description: Five years to the day after the World Series earthquake, there were slight rumblings yesterday in the long dormant negotiations in baseball's labor dispute. Forty days after they last held a bargaining session, representatives of the players and the owners will meet in Washington tomorrow with Bill Usery Jr., the mediator who will try to help them resolve their differences.

title: SBC's Profit Climbs 23.7%
description: SBC Communications Inc., formerly the Southwestern Bell Corporation, said yesterday that earnings rose 23.7 percent in the third quarter, bolstered by strong gains in the cellular telephone business.

title: Darling International reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 1
description: b-Net loss(Loss)

title: Merck and Lilly Post Strong Earnings and Sales
description: Two big pharmaceutical companies, Eli Lilly and Merck, reported strong quarterly sales and earnings growth yesterday. SmithKline Beecham, also an important drug maker, reported a relatively modest 4.9 percent gain as it struggled with price-cutting for generic copies of its flagship Tagamet, a widely used anti-ulcer treatment.

title: Standex Intl.(SXI,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Frisch's Restaurants Inc.(FRS,A) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 18
Nashua Corp.(NSH,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included charges of $ 2.6 million and a loss of $ 2,295,000, or 36 cents a share, from discontinued operations.c-Included a loss of $ 463,000, or 7 cents a share, in the quarter and income of $ 2,463,000, or 39 cents a share, in the 9 months, both from discontinued operations.

title: Octel Communications Corp.(OCTL,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The latest quarter included a one-time charge of $ 4,725,000 on acquired in-process research and development. Before the charge, net income was $ 7,039,000, or 28 cents a share.

title: Aqueduct Opens, but Is It for Last Mile?
description: Aqueduct Race Track opened its autumn season yesterday in bright sunshine but with dark memories of last year's ferocious weather and with gloomy questions about the future of winter racing in New York.

title: 'Shoo-In' for French Presidency in '95 Now Faces a Struggle
description: Prime Minister Edouard Balladur never disguised his strategy for becoming France's next President: he would stand above the political fray and concentrate on governing the country until early next year, when he would emerge as the natural successor to Francois Mitterrand.

title: Region News Briefs; Woman Admits Role In Death of Her Son
description: A Yonkers woman whose 13-month-old son starved to death in his crib last year admitted in court today that she abandoned him for several days while she went on a drug binge.

title: PHILIP MORRIS COS. (MO,N)
description: The Philip Morris Companies reported a 26.8 percent increase in third-quarter net income yesterday, led by strong results in its tobacco business worldwide and improving results in its food and beer businesses. The New York-based maker of Marlboro cigarettes, Kraft foods and Miller beer said net income rose to $1.23 billion, or $1.42 a share, from $967 million, or $1.11, while revenue rose 9.9 percent to $16.71 billion.

title: MICRON TECHNOLOGY PLANS TO BUILD NEW PLANT
description: Micron Technology Inc. said yesterday that it would spend $1.3 billion to build a 200-acre manufacturing complex, possibly in Boise, Idaho, where the maker of computer semiconductors is based. Construction of the plant, which eventually is to employ 3,500 people, is expected to begin within six months. It could take three to four years before the plant reaches full production and employment, the company said. The expansion would be the largest ever for Micron and would double its semiconductor manufacturing capacity in dollar terms, a company spokesman said.

title: Dolphins' Parmalee Is Suddenly a Celebrity
description: It took nine years of unwavering faith in himself for Bernie Parmalee to become an overnight star.

title: The Benefits of Incumbency
description: While polls show 12 years of incumbency may be hurting Gov. Mario M. Cuomo, it also provides perks that opponents say give him an unfair campaign edge. Page B1.

title: LOTUS DEVELOPMENT CORP. (LOTS,NNM)
description: The Lotus Development Corporation reported a third-quarter loss yesterday, citing a charge to complete acquisitions, poor performance in Europe and a slow acceptance of a new purchase plan by corporate customers.

title: Saber Rattling
description: It has become as much of a pattern in the O. J. Simpson trial as the tiffs between Robert L. Shapiro and Marcia Clark or the defendant's cheery smiles to prospective jurors.

title: Stefan Martin; Artist, 58
description: Stefan Martin, an artist noted for his wood engravings, drowned on Oct. 7 in Assunpink Lake in Millstone Township, N.J. He was 58 and lived in Roosevelt, N.J.

title: Book Notes
description: Win a Nobel

title: John Nuveen Co. (JNC,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Acclaim Entertainment Inc.(AKLM,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Aug 31
Stocks Off Ahead of Data on Trade Deficit
description: Stock traders, pausing before the release of today's trade deficit figures, bid down the prices of stocks slightly yesterday, as measured by most leading indexes.

title: U.S. Petroleum Data
description: In millions of barrels except refinery utilization

title: Rochester Telephone Corp.(RTC,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a charge of $ 7,197,000, or 10 cents a share, from change in accounting for postretirement benefits.c-Included $ 1.2 million charge for increased federal income tax; a $ 3.3 million pretax write-off related to a discontinued software project; and a gain of $ 1 million from the ship-off of S&A Telephone in Kansas.

title: SCOTT PAPER UNIT TO EXPAND MEXICAN PLANTS
description: The Scott Paper Company of Philadelphia said yesterday that its board had approved plans by its Mexican affiliate to spend $148 million to expand two plants in Mexico. The plan will be financed by the affiliate, Compania Industrial de San Cristobal S.A., which is half-owned by Scott Paper. Scott, which said in August it would slash 10,500 jobs worldwide by the end of this year, said its Mexican operations would not replace jobs in the United States. Products from the plants are intended to be sold in Mexico, not the United States.

title: Former Empire Blue Cross Financial Chief Indicted for Perjury
description: The former chief financial officer of Empire Blue Cross and Blue Shield was indicted yesterday by a Federal grand jury on charges that he lied to a Senate subcommittee and obstructed its investigation of financial irregularities at the company, the nation's largest medical insurer.

title: In Opening Its Finance, Mexico Bets Long Term
description: Mexican and foreign executives alike welcomed Mexico's wide opening to foreign banks and brokerage houses today, putting aside the prospect of tougher competition to instead emphasize the shot in the arm for Mexico's flagging economy.

title: Endangered Species: Cavities
description: The sound of a drill in the mouth is becoming increasingly rare as Americans' need for dental fillings continues to decline. In 1990, according to the latest survey of 4,206 dentists in private practice, Americans received, per capita, half the number of fillings they required in 1959, even though they were four times as likely to have gone to the dentist. In 1959, more than one dental filling was needed for every man, woman and child, while in 1990, the latest year for which statistics have been compiled, the per capita filling rate was only 0.6.

title: 8 KILLED IN TEXAS AS FLOODS WORSEN
description: Rain, relentless rain, punctuated by thunder and lightning, pounded southeast Texas for a fourth straight day today and showed no signs of letting up.

title: Easter Seal Awards Given in New York
description: A brewer, two national retailers, and a cellular communications company were among the top winners at the 1994 National Easter Seal EDI Awards ceremony last night in New York, honoring communications judged to enhance the independence of people with disabilities.

title: Gallagher (Arthur J.) & Co.  (AJG,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Ex-Lawmaker Indicted in Post Office Scandal
description: In the latest spinoff from the House post office scandal, a Federal grand jury today indicted Joseph P. Kolter, a former Democratic Representative from Pennsylvania, on five felony charges, accusing him of embezzling more than $44,000 in Congressional money for his personal use.

title: Puerto Ricans on Mainland Making Gains, Study Finds
description: Puerto Ricans born in the 50 states made striking economic gains in the 1980's -- so striking that, by one measure, their income now surpasses that of Hispanic residents generally and of American-born blacks, a new national study has concluded. But those who migrated to the mainland from Puerto Rico lag behind mainland-born Puerto Ricans in income, education and employment.

title: Haverty Furniture Cos.  (HAVT,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Owens-Corning Fiberglas Corp.(OCF,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After a gain of $ 85 million, or $ 1.92 a share, from an accounting adjustment. During the first quarter, the company changed its method of accounting for postretirement benefits and postemployment benefits, and changed to the capital method of rebuilding glass-melting furnaces.c-After a gain of $ 26 million, or 60 cents a share, from the cumulative effect of change in accounting for income taxes.

title: Modern Museum Didn't Hide Source of Art
description: To the Editor:

title: Bell Microproducts (BELM,NNM) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Year-ago results have been restated to reflect pooling-of-interests acquisitions with Mainline Industrial Distributors Inc. The company also adopted SFAS 109 during the quarter, which had no material effect on earnings.The company said it recorded a charge of about $ 800,000 relating to its work-force reduction in certain corporate service departments in the latest quarter.

title: GATX Corp.(GMT,N) reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Included a charge of $ 7.4 million to reflect an increase in deferred income taxes in both the quarter and 9 months.

title: Baghdad's Kuwait Caper: Its Isolation Gets Deeper
description: Two weeks after Iraq moved troops toward Kuwait in what some diplomats called a gamble to get the United Nations to lift crippling trade sanctions, the sanctions remain in place and Baghdad has little room for diplomatic or military maneuvering.

title: Governor and Jeb Bush Debate, Exchanging Taunts and Claims of Distorting Truth
description: In a series of heated exchanges today, Gov. Lawton Chiles and his Republican opponent, Jeb Bush, strongly attacked each other during a debate here, with each accusing the other of distorting the truth.

title: FINANCE BRIEFS
description: Debt * Federal Home Loan Bank is selling $30 million of medium-term notes due in 1997 through BA Securities. The notes, which are noncallable, are priced at par to yield 7.02 percent.

title: Comforts of Solving Comfortable Mysteries
description: Andy Griffith has "Matlock." Angela Lansbury has "Murder, She Wrote." Now after trial-balloon success in a two-hour movie this year, Bill Cosby is working on his own retirement annuity in "The Cosby Mysteries," Wednesdays at 8 P.M. on NBC. Mr. Cosby is the star, executive producer and fellow who makes sure his deserving friends and relatives never want for a job. There's usually another Cosby or two embedded in the final credits.

title: New View of Prozac: It's Good But It's Not a Wonder Drug
description: AFTER listening to all the good news about the antidepressant Prozac, researchers are taking a more sober second look. A statistical analysis of 13 studies of the medication finds that it is no more effective than the older generation of antidepressants it has largely swept from the marketplace.

title: Trotting Title Is on the Line
description: Bullville Victory drew Post 5 yesterday for Friday night's $400,000 Cadillac Breeders Crown 3-year-old colt trot at Garden State Park in Cherry Hill, N.J., a race that should determine the divisional champion. Bullville Victory, the 8-5 favorite who will be driven by John Campbell, won two legs of trotting's triple crown, the Yonkers Trot and Kentucky Futurity. The Hambletonian winner, Victory Dream, is a 9-5 second choice with Mike LaChance from Post 2.

title: Illinova Corp.(ILN,N) reports earnings for Year to Sept 30
description: b-Net loss(Loss)

title: Residents Demand Answers In Escaped Prisoner's Death
description: More than 500 people packed the auditorium of Public School 40 in Jamaica, Queens, yesterday in an angry meeting with police officials, demanding to know why a state correction officer fatally shot a man who witnesses say was pinned to the ground.

title: Krystal
description: Shares of the Krystal Company, a fast-food restaurant chain in the South, rose sharply yesterday after the company announced that third-quarter earnings were higher than what analysts had expected, at 28 cents a share, unchanged from last year.

title: Kent Electronics Corp.(KNT,N) reports earnings for 13wks to Oct 1
description: Sales represented net sales.

title: IN PERFORMANCE: DANCE
